name: Salt-Crusted Prime Rib with Holiday Chimichurri
instructions: Reduce a whole bottle of red wine in a saucepan. Infuse with rosemary and thyme.
Combine the reduced red wine with 9 pounds of kosher salt to create a ‘kinetic sand’ like consistency.
Layer some of the red wine salt mixture in the bottom of a roasting pan.
Place the 9-pound prime rib on top of the salt layer.
Build walls of the salt mixture around the prime rib, completely encasing it.
Roast the prime rib until it reaches an internal temperature of 125°F (52°C).
Remove the prime rib from the oven and carefully break away the salt crust.
Sear the prime rib over high heat until it is perfectly seared.
Let the prime rib rest for at least 30 minutes.
While the prime rib rests, prepare the chimichurri: Chop BLANK of garlic, BLANK of parsley and other desired herbs. Whisk together with red wine vinegar and olive oil.
Slice the rested prime rib and serve with the holiday chimichurri.
